required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Long Term Study To Evaluate The Safety And Tolerability Of CP-690,550 For Patients With Moderate To Severe Chronic Plaque Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multi-site, Open-label Study Of The Long Term Safety And Tolerability Of 2 Oral Doses Of Cp-690,550 In Subjects With Moderate To Severe Chronic Plaque Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to evaluate the long-term safety of CP-690,550 in patients being treated for moderate to severe chronic plaque psoriasis. This is an open label extension study available to patients who participated in one of the qualifying studies with CP-690,550 providing entry criteria is met.

detailed_description.textblock: The study terminated on 08MAR2016 as it met its objectives of characterizing long term safety and tolerability. The study did not terminate due to safety concerns.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events during treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of clinical laboratory abnormalities and change from baseline (in this and/or prior study) in clinical laboratory values during treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of investigator-reported clinically significant changes in physical examination from baseline (in this and/or prior study) during treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of vital sign (blood pressure and heart rate) abnormalities and change from baseline (in this and/or prior study) in vital sign measures during treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

primary_outcome.measure: Summary of adjudicated cardiovascular endpoints. Summary of malignancies confirmed by central laboratory pathologist over read of biopsies.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of electrocardiogram (ECG) abnormalities and change from baseline (in this and/or prior study) in ECG measurements during treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Month 6, and every 6 months thereafter until approxinmately June 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) response ie, the proportion of participants achieving a PGA of "clear" or "almost clear" at various time points.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Psoriasis Area and Severity Index 75 (PASI75) response ie, the proportion of participants achieving at least a 75% reduction in PASI relative to baseline (in this and/or prior study) at various time points.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Actual and change from baseline (in this and/or prior study) in PASI and PASI component scores at various time points.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants achieving at least a 50% and 90% reduction in PASI relative to baseline (in this and/or prior study) (ie, PASI50 and PASI90, respectively) at various time points.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with a PASI score >= 125% of the baseline PASI score (in this and/or prior study) at any time point.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Actual and change from baseline (in this and/or prior study) in the Itch Severity Item (ISI) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016

secondary_outcome.measure: Actual and change from baseline (in this and/or prior study) on the Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI) score.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 6, and every six months thereafter until approximately June 2016
Month 6, and then every 6 months thereafter until approximately June 2016
Month 1, month 3, and every three months thereafter until approximately June 2016
Month 6, and then every 6 months thereafter until approximately June 2016
Month 6, and then every 6 months thereafter until approximately June 2016

arm_group.description: The study is anticipated to continue for up to at least 2 years post First Market Approval (FMA) in a global, major market. All subjects will receive 10 mg BID of CP-690,550 for first 3 months of trial. Study has the option for variable dosing with 5 mg or 10 mg BID after first 3-months of treatment based on PI discretion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have participated in qualifying study with CP-690,550 and are 18 years or older with diagnosis of plaque-type psoriasis (psoriasis vulgaris).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-plaque or drug induced forms of psoriasis;
- Cannot discontinue current oral, injectable or topical therapy for psoriasis or cannot discontinue phototherapy (PUVA or UVB).
- Any uncontrolled significant medical condition.
